npcs.name: Adalin Emerael
utterances: Good day to you.

npcs.name: Akeera Sneakshot
utterances: Cover me while we regroup!

npcs.name: Ambassador Jalanderra
utterances: She didn't have to die!

npcs.name: Ambassador Kialee
utterances: Why must it come to this?

npcs.name: Aundor Singingsword
utterances: The forest's blessing to you. It is a good day to practice sword play, is it not?

npcs.name: Bardrian Vorsuth
utterances: Busy... Go away.

npcs.name: Cailee Bluesheaf
utterances: We train to be the best!
Blessings to you and your kin!

npcs.name: Calla Badgerbane
utterances: I am able to answer any questions you have about collections or harvesting.

Harvestables are natural resources that can be found around most parts of the outdoors.  You have harvesting skills that allow you collect them. These can be seen by opening your Character window (C), clicking on the Skills tab, and selecting the General skills. Rocks increase mining, logs increase foresting, dens increase trapping, fish increase fishing, and shrubs increase gathering.

The items found through harvesting are the basic building blocks of tradeskills.  They cannot be sold to vendors, but they can be traded or sold to other players who need them for their respective tradeskill professions.  Some components that can be found through harvesting are very rare and can be worth quite a bit of money to tradeskillers.

The skill required to harvest in a given area increases along with the difficulty of the area.  If you find that you are unable to harvest in an area you should return to a less difficult area and practice.

Collectibles are seen as a glow rising from the ground. If you're close enough, you'll notice a question mark above it. Double-click or right-click the glow and select "harvest." The item you gather will go into your inventory. You can examine this item in your inventory.

Your quest journal will open up automatically to the Collections tab. Use the Add button to add that item to a collection. As you travel through Norrath, you'll find different collectibles in different areas of the world. Some items can be part of more than one collection.

Continue to gather and examine all the items you find until all the icons of that collection are highlighted in your quest journal. Then you'll be able to turn the completed collection in to a collector who will reward you with some experience. If you already have a collectible in all collections that call for it, you can sell it to a merchant or trade it to another player.

npcs.name: a corrupted dryad
utterances: Only I shall foul up this land.
Our darkness spreads.
You are indeed strong, but you cannot stop our scourge.
My blood will continue to taint this land.
My death only furthers my goals.
Going for a nice walk in the woods?
Bet you didn't think you'd run into me here.

npcs.name: Empress Anassa
utterances: Greetings and welcome to our hallowed grove. What is it you seek?
You're the one Eunomia speaks of so highly. You served us well, but the corruption spoiling this forest still looms. We must destroy it!
The evil calls itself Rotweed and lurks in the darkness of Teardrop Cave. It buries itself in the cave walls and exudes corruption upon this woodland.
In this age, all woodlands fight a silent battle. The forces of nature have become twisted and tormented. Rotweed is one of these corrupted creations that taints the woodlands of Norrath.
This is good, but others like Rotweed shall return someday. We will watch and defend. We of this woodland thank you.

npcs.name: Henk Newfield
utterances: At peace or at war, my work must go on.

npcs.name: Jemila
utterances: Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Welcome! What can I help you with?

npcs.name: Judge Eunomia
utterances: Justice is our only recourse when the forests are torn asunder.
You are the one who aided our sapling. You can help me execute my judgment. Twisted, disloyal imposters live in the woodland. They hide amongst the noble, but they don't fool me or my sisters.
They're corrupted fayfolke--bright with beauty but twisted and corrupted to the core. They're called the sunshimmer sprites.  You must destroy them.
You proved your devotion to the dryads of this forest. The Empress has taken note of your good deeds. She awaits you.

npcs.name: Lieutenant Charlin
utterances: Did you interrupt the meeting?
What did you discover?
Gnolls? Then all the reports were right. And that Gilrix. He was mentioned in one of the materials we obtained concerning this whole mess. But we may be a step ahead of them for once.

The book we obtained had lots of notes and plans. The book you've provided to us has all their contingency plans. If you've disrupted the meeting then the gnolls won't know precisely what happened and will fall to one of their backup plans. This gives us an excellent opportunity to strike.

Well, with this book we've got the locations where the gnoll lieutenants will be in hiding while they await orders from Gilrix. While they wait, they are vulnerable. One will be near here--take the path west and turn north before you go under the bridge, that should put you very near him, he's hiding in an alcove.
Another will be on the rocky hill south east of Clearwater Pond. The last will be in a small alcove just north west of the Western Falls.
Taking them out will be a huge victory for us here, good luck.
Have you taken out the lieutenants?
This is great news! With their lieutenants dead the gnoll presence here will be in shambles. Those that don't flee will easily be captured. You have done a great, great thing.
This land and our people owe you. Thank you.
Be careful out there, citizen.

Oh, I don't know, what was it last time I checked? Poachers maybe, or corruption spreading through the forest, I even heard some guy mention a gnoll. Things are bad, don't let me convince you otherwise, but don't believe the people who say the Oakmyst Forest is in serious danger.

Well... I do get nervous when the Tunarian Alliance steps in. It's probably nothing, but they requested a stronger Qeynos Guard presence here. I think they know more than I do.  Still, the danger Oakmyst Forest is in is pretty minor.
Minor danger. Sure, we can use help, but it's not an emergency like some might have you believe. Would you care to volunteer?

Good, glad to hear it. Even without all this "supposed" stuff going on I've got my share of duties. An adventurer was slain recently in these parts. Our initial report back seems to suggest poison. The problem is we have no idea what kind of poison. We know that certain animals in the forest use poison. We suspect that the poachers also use it.

Well, the poachers are spry enough to avoid detection, so we can't get a sample of their poison from them. We can, however, collect poison samples from some of the wildlife here and use that as a starting point. At most, we can find out what caused the death, and at the least we eliminate some possibilities. What do you say?
Good. Collect some poison samples from frogs, mystail rats, and the spiders. They can all be found in Oakmyst.

npcs.name: Lulien Leafven
utterances: Another day, another bullseye!
Practice makes perfect!
I've been here so long, that I don't even have to look at the target to hit it!

npcs.name: Madeline
utterances: I hate the night shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.
Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Monteh Furthread
utterances: To arms!
Flee now or meet this one's fate.
All hands retreat!

npcs.name: Observer Galadn
utterances: And you, adventurer.

npcs.name: Rinduil Flintflight
utterances: Can you not see that I'm concentrating?

npcs.name: Scholar Neola
utterances: Why do you tread upon the fertile ground? Doing so taints the lustrous blades that our young sapling needs to grow.
The young sapling is still weak. It feeds upon the mana of this thicket but needs greater nutrients to prosper in this woodland.
I cannot leave this woodland, but you can. Within the City of Qeynos an alchemist has created a powerful nutrient that will aid the sapling. Retrieve this prized item and feed it to the growing tree.
The sapling has a long battle ahead to become a timber lord. Your help brings it closer to this goal. Now you must seek out the Judge. She awaits those who aid this forest.

npcs.name: a shady furrier
utterances: Look alive! We have visitors!
Your overconfidence will be your undoing.
We must withdraw before we all die!
Cover me while we regroup!
Keep up the assault, no matter what the cost in lives!

npcs.name: Steward Tredo
utterances: Oh no! Poacher! Poacher! I can tell! I can tell!
Not a poacher, I see. Thank the misty winds! Sorry for thinking otherwise. With all the babble of poachers lurking Oakmyst, I thought for sure your strange face would be the last sight I'd see!

npcs.name: Stormbrace
utterances: I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: Toppa Doppster
utterances: You'll be a hero among my friends!
You there! Do you think you can help me?

My friends sent me out to collect some glowmyst juice from the beetles here in Oakmyst. You see, we're trying to start our own tavern and we're working on our craft. I was sent out here to collect some glowmyst juice, but...
These bugs are so disgusting! I can't stand touching them. Don't even get me started on extracting their fluid sacs.
Would you? That would be wonderful! I need ten glowmyst fluid sacs.

npcs.name: Tracker Galera
utterances: The beauty of Oakmyst sometimes overwhelms me but not as much as the sight of Ferith'Anar!
Ferith'Anar is only the most illustrious and sacred creature that trots these woods! She is a unicorn ... far from her home in the sovereign forests of Faydark.
